content.description: Start to the left of Effigy on the same ledge. Sit start on a good jug/pocket rail and make a slightly dynamic movement up to a sloper/jug just below the lip. Top out on tree roots.
content.location: To the left of Effigy on a small ledge in the corner of the Holey Land.

content.description: Stand start on a good pocket rail with decent feet in the middle of the face. Go straight up using good pockets and edges to top out.
content.location: In another alcove of hole-y ledges to the right and upstream of the main Holey Land area. If you are at the start of the Crusader traverse, this other area is just to your left around the corner. This problem is in the middle of a small pocket-filled ledge to your immediate left when you walk in from the main area.

content.description: Sit start to Effigy, start directly below the stand start with your left hand on an undercling nub low and your right hand in the crack.
content.location: Sit start to Effigy, in the far back right corner of the main Holey Land area.

content.description: Stand starts far right in a crack and left-hand dish below the crack on the small ledge in the corner of the Holey Land. Then traverse using amazing Hueco-esque pockets to below the tree on the top of the boulder. Top out straight up and to the right of the tree.
content.location: In the far right corner of the Holey Land on a small ledge with a tree growing from the top. Directly across from the Obelisk.

content.description: The crux is definitely the start. Sit start nearly laying down, your left hand around the sloper edge below the eye hole. Your right-hand stretches to the far-right arete in line with a good crimp edge down low. Get an awkward high left or right foot on a small crimp or a small foot underneath the small overhang on the bottom of the boulder. You will likely need to toe hook or heel hook around the small arete on the left below the eye. After pulling off the ground, go to a good right-hand crimp edge in line with the eye. Move into the eye and then to the top.
content.location: This problem is on a rather odd, small boulder on the hill above Holey Land. From the Riverside boulder, it is up towards the trail and to the left. The boulder is not more than 7 feet high and features a super strange, cyclops-like eye hole above two-thirds of the way up (facing the Holey Land).

content.description: Start as far right as you can, this boulder is not very tall. Traverse left on good pinches, pockets, and edges. Top out just past the Eastern Hemlock at the peak of the boulder.
content.location: I roughly 6-8 foot tall long boulder in the Holey Land area. It will be the first wall that you see coming from the Trailside boulder. It is directly opposite the 30-foot tall slab.

content.description: A medium alcove of very large boulders close to the river. The rock is very water-formed and worth a visit to see the formations.
